incidents.name: API Manager cannot apply policies on runtime plane.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved and all functions are operational.
Monitoring and validation of stability and performance levels have now begun. We’ll provide an update in 60 minutes or sooner if additional information becomes available.
We are aware of a service disruption that may impact you and are currently working on a solution to resolve user impact. Customers will not be able to apply Policies to the runtimes.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

We are continuing to investigate this issue.

We are aware of a feature degradation that may impact you and are currently working on a solution to resolve user impact. During a feature degradation, certain features are unavailable or run at less than optimal performance. We’ll provide an update in 30 minutes or sooner if additional information becomes available.

incidents.name: Anypoint MQ Connector Slow Responses and Timeouts

incident_updates.body:
_Our commitment to you:_  
_We sincerely apologize for the impact this issue caused you and your business. It is our goal to provide world-class service to our customers, and we are continuously assessing and improving our tools, processes, and architecture to provide our customers with the best service possible._

_Root Cause Analysis Document Link:_ [_RCA: MuleSoft - Anypoint MQ Connector Slow Responses and Timeouts in the US Region - August 22, 2024_](https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=002717248&type=1)

_If you have additional questions or need further support, please open a case with Support via the Help portal._

We’ve confirmed that the solution implemented to mitigate the issue causing the disruption was successful. Engineers have observed that the service is now stable and have declared the incident resolved. Customers should no longer see any impact. We will perform a full investigation of the incident, confirming the technical trigger, the underlying cause, and preventive action to avoid a repeat in the future. We apologize for how you and your business may have been affected by this incident.

incidents.name: Authentication tokens failing

incident_updates.body:
_Our commitment to you:_  
_We sincerely apologize for the impact this issue caused you and your business. It is our goal to provide world-class service to our customers, and we are continuously assessing and improving our tools, processes, and architecture to provide our customers with the best service possible._

_Root Cause Analysis Document Link:_ [_RCA: MuleSoft - Authentication Tokens Failing in US Region - August 19, 2024_](https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=002717250&type=1)

_If you have additional questions or need further support, please open a case with Support via the Help portal._

This incident has been resolved.

MuleSoft Customers who have configured the Microsoft Entra ID Identity provider and the OpenID Policy may have no longer been able access to their APIs. APIs with the Microsoft Entra ID Identity provider and the OpenID Policy applied rejected any requests with uncached tokens. Tokens cached would’ve been accepted until their defined expiration or a maximum time if it was configured at the runtime level
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We’re investigating the cause of the issue. We will provide an update in 60 minutes or sooner if we have more information.

incidents.name: Customers may experience problems with Mule Runtimes restarting

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We’re investigating the cause of the issue. We will provide an update in 60 minutes or sooner if we have more information.

incidents.name: Help Center Downloads page not functioning correctly

incident_updates.body:
We’ve confirmed that the solution implemented to mitigate the issue causing the disruption was successful.

Customers should no longer see any impact and we have confirmed that Downloads are visible when accessing via: Anypoint Platform -> Help Center -> Support -> Downloads.

We will perform a full investigation of the incident, confirming the technical trigger, the underlying cause, and preventive action to avoid a repeat in the future. We apologize for how you and your business may have been affected by this incident.
We’re investigating the cause of the issue. We will provide an update in 60 minutes or sooner if we have more information.

We are aware of a feature disruption that may impact you and are currently working on a solution to resolve user impact. Downloading of any resource from the Help Center Downloads page is not functioning correctly. This impacts downloading of Licenses and other resources.

We’ll provide an update in 60 minutes or sooner if additional information becomes available.

incidents.name: CloudHub 2.0 Runtime 4.6.6:4 deployment failure.

incident_updates.body: A workaround has been put in place KB CH2.0 | RTF | Deployment of a Mule application on Runtime 4.6.6:4 and Java17 to address the issue and handle any in-coming Customer escalations - https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=002520703&type=1
Engineers are still working on deploying the fix.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We continue to investigate the issue; we are glad to report that the blast radius is limited to only Customers that manually upgrade to the new Runtime v4.6.6:4

We are investigating an issue where some US Prod Customers are observing deployment failures failure with LTS Runtime 4.6.6:4 and java17 on CloudHub 2.0, Engineering teams are investigating and will provide more information as soon as we can.

incidents.name: CloudHub 1.0 Service disruption.

incident_updates.body:
_Our commitment to you:_  
_We sincerely apologize for the impact this issue caused you and your business. It is our goal to provide world-class service to our customers, and we are continuously assessing and improving our tools, processes, and architecture to provide our customers with the best service possible._

_Root Cause Analysis Document Link:_ [_MuleSoft - Customers were unable to access CloudHub applications in Runtime Manager and APIs - July 17, 18, 2024_](https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=002466350&type=1)

_If you have additional questions or need further support, please open a case with Support via the Help portal._

Between 11:54 PT (18:54 UTC) and 12:08 PT (19:08 UTC)  CloudHub 1.0 customers may have experienced issues while attempting to manage their applications, also between 11:55 PT (18:55 UTC) and 12:14 PT (19:08 UTC) API Manager customers weren't able to deploy APIs to CloudHub 1.0 and status of APIs deployed to CloudHub 1.0 were not visible.

We’ve confirmed that the solution implemented to mitigate the issue causing the disruption was successful. Engineers have observed that the services are now stable and have declared the issue resolved. Customers should no longer see any impact. We will perform a full investigation of the issue, confirming the technical trigger, the underlying cause, and preventive action to avoid a repeat in the future. We apologize for how you and your business may have been affected by this incident.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

Starting 11:54 PT (18:54 UTC) Customers might experience issues while trying to manage CloudHub 1.0 applications, services returned to normal at 12:08 PT (19:08 UTC) we are monitoring the stability of our systems.

incidents.name: Intelligent Document Processing (IDP) Executions issue from 05:18 PT June 27th to 08:33 PT June 28th

incident_updates.body: We experienced a service disruption that, upon detailed analysis, was declared an incident retroactively. Our team implemented a solution that successfully restored full functionality and stability to the affected service. Continuous monitoring has confirmed that the service remains stable with no ongoing issues. We are committed to understanding and learning from this incident. We will conduct a thorough investigation to identify the root cause, and contributing factors, and develop effective preventative measures for the future.  We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused and appreciate your understanding as we strive to uphold and improve the reliability of our services.

incidents.name: Exchange Catalog is unable to complete data indexing communication.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results. There is a backlog of requests being processed, and engineers are actively monitoring progress
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.

We are currently looking into a problem where the Exchange Catalog is unable to communicate with other components for data indexing purposes. While the Exchange Catalog has a temporary solution in place, API Manager might not have similar workarounds available. Consequently, if API Manager depends on other components for displaying new APIs and Custom Policies, these items may not appear as expected. We are working to resolve this issue and will share updates as soon as possible.

incidents.name: API Manager and Analytics degraded experience

incident_updates.body: As of 06:52, API Analytics is working normally. We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused and appreciate your patience throughout this process. Our team has worked diligently to address and mitigate the situation to ensure the stability and reliability of our services.

We have seen full recovery in API Manager, Exchange and Scheduler.
API Analytics continues trending towards full recovery.

Our teams continue to monitor.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.

We continue to observe degraded conditions in several platform features:

- API Manager may display errors or slowness
- API Analytics may be delayed or display a blank page when fetching reports
- CloudHub 2 schedulers may not be displayed correctly, running of schedules not impacted
- Exchange may display errors or slowness

Our engineering team continues to work on resolving this issue.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
Customers may experience errors or delays while using API Manager and API Analytics. Our teams are investigating.

incidents.name: API Manager, Anypoint Analytics, and Exchange are experience UI Degradation

incident_updates.body: As of 2:01 AM PDT  the issue has been resolved. We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused and appreciate your patience throughout this process. Our team has worked diligently to address and mitigate the situation to ensure the stability and reliability of our services.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We have identified the initial cause of this impact and have applied a remediation.  We are currently working to identify and address
Customers may experience performance degradation and errors while using API Manager, API Analytics, and Exchange. Our teams are investigating.

incidents.name: API Manager degraded performance

incident_updates.body:
_Our commitment to you:_  
_We sincerely apologize for the impact this issue caused you and your business. It is our goal to provide world-class service to our customers, and we are continuously assessing and improving our tools, processes, and architecture to provide our customers with the best service possible._

_Root Cause Analysis Document Link:_ [_RCA: MuleSoft - API Manager Performance Degradation in US Region - Monday, April 29, 2024_](https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=001862269&type=1)

_If you have additional questions or need further support, please open a case with Support via the Help portal._
This incident has been resolved.

incident_updates.body: As of 14:00 PT the issue was resolved, customers are no longer experiencing 400 errors when re-ordering policies in API Manager.
We are investigating an issue where API Manager is returning 400 errors when re-ordering policies, we will provide more information as soon as we can.

incidents.name: Anypoint Exchange OAS asset not working

incident_updates.body: As of 2:39 PM PT the issue has been resolved. We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused and appreciate your patience throughout this process. Our team has worked diligently to address and mitigate the situation to ensure the stability and reliability of our services.
Customers downloading assets as OAS in the Anypoint Exchange UI may get a corrupt zip file. Our teams are investigating.

incidents.name: Infra Status showing 'Not Available' in UI

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented we are monitoring the progress.

We have identified an issue where the Runtime Manager dashboard is indicating Infra Status is 'Not Available'. Engineers are working on a fix to resolve this message. No functionality is impacted at this time.

incidents.name: Cloud Hub 2 Logs not visible

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
Customers may experience issues viewing Cloud Hub 2 application logs in Runtime Manager. Engineering teams have identified the problem and continue to implement measures to resolve the issue.
Customers may experience issues viewing Cloud Hub 2 application logs in Runtime Manager. Engineering teams have identified the problem and we are starting to implement measures towards resolution.
Customers may experience an issue viewing Cloud Hub 2 application logs while using Runtime Manager. Our teams are investigating.

incidents.name: Mule App deployments to CloudHub 2.0 Shared Spaces for Mule runtimes 4.6 and above are failing.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
Titanium customers who deploy Mule runtimes 4.6 and above on CloudHub 2.0 Shared Spaces with tracing will see new deployments fail. Runtimes are not impacted. Our teams are investigating.

incidents.name: Customers may experience problems with creating a new Private Space in CloudHub 2.0

incident_updates.body: As of 02:47 am Pacific, the issue has been resolved, and Private Space creation while using CloudHub 2.0 is fully functional. We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused and appreciate your patience throughout this process. Our team has worked diligently to address and mitigate the situation to ensure the stability and reliability of our services.

Customers will experience failures while attempting to create/provision a new private space.

Engineering teams have identified the problem and we are working towards resolution.  There is no impact to existing private spaces, applications or any other activities.
Customers may experience a failure when attempting to create a new Private Space while using CloudHub 2.0. Our teams are investigating.

incidents.name: Runtime Fabric Customers might see a banner to upgrade

incident_updates.body: The issue has been resolved. We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused and appreciate your patience throughout this process. Our team has worked diligently to address and mitigate the situation to ensure the stability and reliability of our services.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

We identified an issue on which Runtime Fabric customers will see a banner to upgrade to the latest release, there's no new release and this is an error pointing to a previous release, do not upgrade.

incidents.name: Performance degradation in CloudHub services

incident_updates.body:
For approximately an hour starting shortly after 13:00 PT, there was an event causing performance degradation across CloudHub services. Some app schedules may not have triggered during this time.

This issue is now resolved, and this is a retroactive posting.

incidents.name: Anypoint Monitoring Charts Errors

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are currently investigating an issue where customers are not able to view Anypoint Monitoring charts.

incidents.name: Runtime Manager Scheduler not showing in UI

incident_updates.body: This issue has been resolved, if you are still experiencing the impact described please see the previous post on steps to take to resolve the situation for your application.

We have identified the issue that was causing newly deployed applications with schedulers are not deploying the schedulers in the Schedules page of the applications. Any applications deployed between 8:09 AM Pacific time and 7:32 PM Pacific time may still be experiencing this issue.  Any new applications deployed after 7:32PM Pacific time are functioning fine.  We are moving this incident to monitoring.

If you have an application that is not displaying the schedulers in the Schedules UI page when you expect it to, you can take the following steps to correct that situation:

* you have to publish a new version of your asset to exchange
* then redeploy your application using the new version of the asset

Optionally, If the applications are deployed directly from the Runtime Manager UI without assets published manually then you can upload the same JAR file in the applications settings page.

Customers may experience issues with new deployments of a mule application that contains Schedulers to a Cloudhub 2.0 Private Space from the Runtime Manager UI after deployment they may not be able to manage the schedules through the Anypoint Runtime Manager UI.  We are continuing to work on identifying the cause of this issue.
Customers may experience issues where the scheduler does not show in the Runtime UI. Our teams are investigating.

incidents.name: Retroactive Post: Object Store Stats unavailable

incident_updates.body:
We experienced an issue from 2024-03-22 01:25 Pacific to 2024-03-22 01:51 Pacific, where requests were not received by one of our services.

This affected Object Store Stats resulting in 5XX errors when customers tried to access that feature. Our engineering teams have resolved this issue and are taking the necessary steps to prevent such issues in the future.

affected_components.name: Object Store v2 - Object Store v2 - Stats - us-east-1

incidents.name: Documentation Site Unavailable

incident_updates.body: The issue has been resolved.
Engineering teams have implemented a fix and we are monitoring the services.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue. The site docs.mulesoft.com is intermittently impacted and may be accessible at this time.
Customers may experience the error "no healthy upstream" while using docs.mulesoft.com. Engineering teams have identified the problem and we are working towards resolution. Runtimes are not impacted.

incidents.name: Anypoint Platform experiencing some errors

incident_updates.body:
_Our commitment to you:_  
_We sincerely apologize for the impact this issue caused you and your business. It is our goal to provide world-class service to our customers, and we are continuously assessing and improving our tools, processes, and architecture to provide our customers with the best service possible._

_Root Cause Analysis Document Link:_ [_RCA: Anypoint Platform errors received for US Region - 21 March 2024_](https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=001537343&type=1)

_If you have additional questions or need further support, please open a case with Support via the Help portal._
The issue has been resolved.
Engineering teams have implemented a fix and we are monitoring the services.

Customers will experience 401 coming from Access Management, API Manager might return 401 while getting open ID policies, Runtime Fabric customers might experience issues while downloading Docker images.
Some customers may be experiencing timeouts with certain API policies. Engineering teams are actively investigating the issue

incidents.name: Customers may experience problems with usage reports.

incident_updates.body: As of 2:33 PM PT the issue has been resolved.  We will be providing an RCA via our support portal in the next 5 business days.
Customers may experience issues while viewing usage report data. Our teams are investigating.

incidents.name: Anypoint Partner Manager Transmission Status not Visible in UI

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved outbound transmissions are now appearing as expected in the Partner Manager UI.

Inbound acknowledgements for outbound transmissions with multiple messages fail to reconcile against corresponding outbound transmission. Engineers have identified this issue and a fix is currently being implemented.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.

We have discovered an issue where customers may not be able to see that status of outbound transmission with multiple messages from the Partner Manager activity UI. Transmissions are functioning as expected however the UI is not displaying the status. Engineers have identified this issue and a fix is being implemented.

A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
